episode_summary: Guest comedian Amy Gledhill joins Dan, James, and Andy for facts about North Carolina’s strict bingo limits, Pizza Express’s trial of staff flirting, Laurel and Hardy’s multilingual film shoots, and the Aunt Bessie brand’s nuclear-deterrent-inspired origin. The chat ranges through bingo culture and calls, AI-aided flirting, classic comedy double acts, and Hull/Yorkshire food lore.

facts.fact: In North Carolina, it's illegal to play Bingo for six hours straight.
